title: Tagging Instagram on Facebook: Everything You Need to Know

steps.title: Yes, but only by posting to a Facebook Page through Business Suite.
steps.content: Yes, but only by posting to a Facebook Page through Business Suite. It’s totally possible to tag Instagram users in a Facebook post, but doing so is a bit tricky. The most reliable way to do it is using the web browser version of the Meta Business Suite .

steps.title: Your options are more limited on a personal Facebook profile.
steps.content: Your options are more limited on a personal Facebook profile. You can’t tag an Instagram user in a regular Facebook post, although that option might become available in the future. However, for now, you can cross-post between Instagram and Facebook. You can also share links to Instagram posts or profiles in a Facebook post.

steps.title: Go to the Meta Business Suite.
steps.content: Go to the Meta Business Suite. In a web browser, visit https://business.facebook.com and log in with the account associated with your Page. This method will only work if you have a Page associated with a Meta business portfolio . You can also do this from the Business Suite app, but we found that method to be less reliable in our testing.

steps.title: Link your Instagram account to your Facebook business portfolio.
steps.content: Link your Instagram account to your Facebook business portfolio. Before you can tag Instagram accounts, you have to link your Facebook portfolio to a professional Instagram account . Use the following steps to link your accounts: [1] X Research source Select a profile page using the drop-down menu at the top of the menu on the left. Click Connect Instagram at the top of the page. Click Log in to Instagram or Create a new Instagram profile . Follow the prompts to log into an Instagram page or create a new Instagram.

steps.title: Click Create Post.
steps.content: Click Create Post . You’ll see this blue button near the top of the page.

steps.title: Select both your page and your Instagram profile in "Post To."
steps.content: Select both your page and your Instagram profile in "Post To." Locate the Post To dropdown menu at the top left side of the Create post page. Check the boxes next to your Facebook page and your Instagram account. You must have both accounts selected in order to tag an Instagram profile in your post! However, you can choose to publish only to Facebook once you’ve finished tagging the Instagram user.

steps.title: Enter some text or an image.
steps.content: Enter some text or an image. If you only enter text, the post will only be published on Facebook—even if you have both Facebook and Instagram selected under “Post To.” If you want to post in both places, add an image or video to your post.

steps.title: Write an @ followed by an Instagram account name.
steps.content: Write an @ followed by an Instagram account name. Once you type the @, a menu will pop up suggesting possible matches based on any letters you enter next. Type the full name of the account you want to tag or select the correct suggestion from the list.

steps.title: Remove your Instagram account from Post To (optional).
steps.content: Remove your Instagram account from Post To (optional). If you only want to publish your post on Facebook, click the dropdown menu and deselect your Instagram account. The tag in your post will still work!

steps.title: Click Publish.
steps.content: Click Publish . Your post will now be published to your Facebook Page with the Instagram user tagged. When you click the link to the tagged account, their profile will open in Instagram.

steps.title: Open the Instagram App.
steps.content: Open the Instagram App. To cross-post between your personal Facebook page and your Instagram account, you’ll need to link your accounts. You can do this easily from the Instagram app. This app icon looks like a pink, purple, and orange camera icon.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. It's in the lower-right corner of Instagram and displays your user profile. [2] X Research source If you're not logged into the right Instagram account, make sure you do that before continuing.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . You'll see this three-line menu icon in the upper-right corner of your profile page and tapping it will prompt a menu to drop-down. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . You'll find this at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Accounts . It’s at the bottom of the menu that pops up when you go to Accounts Center . From here, you can see a list of accounts that are already linked to your Accounts Center. Check if the Facebook account you want to add is already listed.

steps.title: Tap Add Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Add Accounts . It’s at the top of the Accounts menu.

steps.title: Tap Continue if you’re prompted to do so.
steps.content: Tap Continue if you’re prompted to do so. A message may pop up, prompting you to log into instagram.com. If you see this, tap Continue and follow the prompts to sign in.

steps.title: Tap Add Facebook Account.
steps.content: Tap Add Facebook Account . Follow the prompts to finish connecting your selected Facebook profile.

steps.title: Navigate to the Instagram user’s profile.
steps.content: Navigate to the Instagram user’s profile. As an alternative to tagging someone’s Instagram account, you can share a link to their profile in a Facebook post. This is a pretty quick and simple process if your {{#Linking Facebook to Instagram|Instagram and Facebook accounts are linked}}. Start by visiting the person’s profile on the Instagram app or website.

steps.title: Tap the icon with three dots ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the icon with three dots ⋮ . It's in the upper-right corner. If you’re on the Instagram website on a desktop computer, click ••• at the top of their profile instead.

steps.title: Tap Share this Profile.
steps.content: Tap Share this Profile . It's in the menu that appears when you tap the icon with three dots at the top of an Instagram profile. If you are using a computer, tap Share to… .

steps.title: Select the Facebook icon.
steps.content: Select the Facebook icon. This will generate a Facebook post with a link to the profile you’re sharing. The link will display as a preview card with the user’s Instagram profile picture and username. If you are using a computer, tap Share to Facebook instead.

steps.title: Add text (optional) and tap Post.
steps.content: Add text (optional) and tap Post . Add a caption to your post if you like, and make any other adjustments you want before tapping or clicking Post .

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. This app icon looks like a pink, purple, and orange camera icon. Use this method if you plan to share only certain posts from Instagram to Facebook.

steps.title: Create your post.
steps.content: Create your post. To do this , tap the + icon at the top or bottom of your screen, then choose Post . You can then use an image from your gallery or take your own picture/video and tap Next at the top. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Edit the post and tap Next.
steps.content: Edit the post and tap Next . You can use any of the tools at the bottom of the screen to add music, text, or a filter. Then tap Next in the lower-right corner.

steps.title: Scroll down and toggle on the switch next to your Facebook profile.
steps.content: Scroll down and toggle on the switch next to your Facebook profile. If you have multiple other Meta accounts linked to your Instagram account, locate the Facebook profile at the bottom of the page below "Share To". Toggle the switch next to it to the On position. You can also share a post to your Instagram account.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . It's the purple button at the bottom of the page. This cross-posts your post to both Instagram and Facebook. Unless you have all posts set to share to your other accounts automatically, you’ll need to repeat this process to share any future posts from Instagram to Facebook.

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. This app icon looks like a pink, purple, and orange camera icon. Use this method if you want to automatically share every post you create on Instagram to Facebook.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. It's in the lower-right corner of Instagram and displays your user profile.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . You'll see this three-line menu icon in the upper-right corner of your profile page and tapping it will prompt a menu to drop-down. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . You'll find this at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Sharing across profiles.
steps.content: Tap Sharing across profiles . You'll see all your connected accounts from here. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your Instagram account.
steps.content: Tap your Instagram account. Since you're intending to share all or most of your Instagram posts on Facebook, you want to set this up so that your Instagram account acts as the default account. If you post more on Facebook and want to share all those posts to Instagram rather than the other way around, like you're doing here, complete these steps using your Facebook account instead.

steps.title: Select your Facebook account for the "Share to" section.
steps.content: Select your Facebook account for the "Share to" section. You're sharing posts from Instagram to Facebook, so you want to make sure you have the correct Facebook account selected here. The circle will fill in to indicate that it is selected. [7] X Research source In this case, all posts or videos that you create on Instagram will also be posted to your Facebook account.

steps.title: Opt to share your Instagram stories, posts, and or reels.
steps.content: Opt to share your Instagram stories, posts, and or reels. Since you're intending on sharing your posts, tap the toggle switch next to "Your Instagram posts" to toggle it on. The switch will be to the right to indicate that it is enabled. [8] X Research source You can also toggle on sharing for stories and reels if you like. Alternatively, you can access these settings by going to ☰ > Crossposting > Accounts Center . You can also use the Crossposting menu to set up crossposting to a Page instead of your personal Facebook profile.

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. This app icon looks like a pink, purple, and orange camera icon. This will only work if the Instagram profile is set to "Public." You can't share posts from private profiles.

steps.title: Find a post you want to share.
steps.content: Find a post you want to share. You can find the latest posts from the people you follow on your home page. You can also tap the magnifying glass icon at the bottom of the screen and use the search bar to search for Instagram posts by user or title. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Share icon below the post.
steps.content: Tap the Share icon below the post. The Share icon looks like a paper airplane. Tap it to open a menu of sharing options.

steps.title: Tap the Facebook icon.
steps.content: Tap the Facebook icon. You’ll see a Facebook icon in the row of buttons at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Type a brief message (optional).
steps.content: Type a brief message (optional). If you want to say something about the Instagram post, type it in the space above the image. If you see the attachment saying "Page Not Found," then the Instagram post you're sharing might be set as private.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . It's in the upper-right corner of the Facebook app. This posts the Instagram post to Facebook.
